eligibility: Candidates must have completed their 10+2 level or equivalent exams (AISSCE/IB/ICSE/State Board, etc.). Indian nationals and Overseas Citizens of India (OCI) are eligible. No upper age limit. Maximum three attempts in consecutive years.[2]
duration: 90 minutes (Written Test: 60 minutes for GPT, 30 minutes for DAT) + 30 minutes (Personal Interview)[1]

faqs.question: What is the selection process for Pearl Academy Entrance Exam?
faqs.answer: The selection process includes a written test (General Proficiency Test and Design Aptitude Test), followed by a personal interview. Candidates may also submit a portfolio during the interview.[1][2]
